title: Silent meeting, a wonder to the world, yet practised by the Apostles and owned by the people of God, scornfully called Quakers
author: Britten, William, d. 1669.
notes: Smith's catalogue of Friends' books (I, 320) notes 3 "editions," all presumably with the same imprint; Wing (B4825) records 2 "issues."
Reproduction of original in Friends' Library, London, and Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
